lead_paragraph: Letters received by the steamship Yacht mention that the battles at Camargo, between the Government troops and revolutionists, took place on the 10th, and lasted for a period of eighteen hours. The Government troops were defeated, with a loss of 60 killed and wounded. Among the latter was Gen. Morales. Three other officers were killed.
